channel.title: VPS help Please
channel.description:
Alright before i buy a vps i wanna know exactly what im up for.
I have Some questions for you guys, and was wondering if u could answer them
1.What is a good VPS site? 2.On the Vps Computer do i need to portforward, set enviroment variables, or dl jdk? 3.How do i get my server files onto the Vps Computer?
Thanks-Draco

item.title: VPS help Please
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Draco Owner Draco
item.description:
@Owner_Draco wrote:

[quote=“Telenim, post:2, topic:285211”]1. VPSLand.com or the one I use for $39 a year.
2. Depends, most of the time no.
3. Depends if it’s Linux or Windows /(RDC or SSH).[/quote]
Well I want to buy a Windows Vps. And what is the one for 39 dollars a year? and how much RAM is it?[quote=“the hunt”]vpsland.com is what everyone uses,
yes, no portforwarding though i dont think
There should be a tool[/quote]

Ok well i have to download JDK and set enviroment variables on it?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 24, 2009, 01:53:51 pm[/size][hr]Please Someone Reply

Read full topic

item.title: VPS help Please
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

  1. VPSLand.com or the one I use for $39 a year.
  2. Depends, most of the time no.
  3. Depends if it’s Linux or Windows /(RDC or SSH).
